com.ep.ggs.world.blocks.classicmodel

Class ClassicBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ep.ggs.world.blocks.classicmodel.ClassicBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Block, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Air, Aqua, Bedrock, Black, Blue, Bookshelf, Brick, BrownShroom, CoalOre, Cobblestone, Cyan, DoubleStair, Glass, GoldBlock, GoldOre, Gray, Green, Indigo, IronBlock, IronOre, Leaves, Lime, Magenta, MossyCobblestone, Obsidian, Orange, PhysicsBlock, Pink, Purple, Red, RedShroom, Sapling, Sponge, Stair, StationaryLava, StationaryWater, Stone, TNT, Unknown, Violet, White, Wood, WoodenPlank, Yellow

    public abstract class ClassicBlock
extends Object
implements Serializable, Block
    This abstract class represents a block that can be placed in the level.
    This class can be extended to create custom blocks, if you wish to create a physics block, then try using a PhysicsBlock.PhysicsBlock(byte, String)
    To add a block, you would call the static method addBlock(ClassicBlock). This will allow other plugins, commands
    to find your block, be sure to use a unused ID, otherwise you will throw an InvalidBlockAddException#InvalidBlockAddException().
    Author:
    MCForgeTeam
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getBlock

        public static ClassicBlock getBlock(byte ID)
        Get a block by ID
        Parameters:
        ID - The ID of the block to look for
        Returns:
        An empty version of the block with the basic information in it
        If the block specified isn't found, then a new Unknown block is return
        You can check to see if an the Unknown block was returned by doing
        getBlock(0).name.equals("NULL")

      • getBlock

        public static ClassicBlock getBlock(String name)
        Get a block by name
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the block to look for
        Returns:
        An empty version of the block with the basic information in it
        If the block specified isn't found, then a new Unknown block is return
        You can check to see if an the Unknown block was returned by doing
        getBlock("ABlock").name.equals("NULL")
